title: 10 years after Paris attacks: Researchers studying survivors' memories 'owe it to victims'

title: Ukraine's justice and energy ministers resign over corruption case
subhead: Anti-corruption prosecutors alleged that Justice Minister German Galushchenko received 'personal benefits' from a $100 million kickback scheme in the energy sector. Energy Minister Svitlana Grynchuk, who is not known to have been charged in the case, also said she was resigning.

title: 'There is one issue on which Warren Buffett does not compromise: The greed of corporate executives'
subhead: At 95 years old, the legendary investor is preparing to step down as chair of Berkshire Hathaway. In a letter to shareholders, he delivers a lesson in humility, writes Isabelle Chaperon, columnist for Le Monde's economy desk.

title: Antonin Tron appointed Balmain's new creative director
subhead: The 41-year-old French designer, who founded his own label Atlein and worked for several prestigious Parisian fashion houses, has been chosen to succeed Olivier Rousteing.

title: COP30: 'What is at stake in Belem is also, in geopolitical terms, the assertion of a Global South'
subhead: In stark contrast to the short-sighted dogmatism of Donald Trump, countries of the 'Souths' share a rational approach to the scientific evidence on climate change and its origins, observes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.

title: Nicolas Sarkozy leaves jail under strict judicial supervision
subhead: The former president cannot leave France and is prohibited from contacting any of the 17 individuals associated with the investigation. The court also barred him from meeting with any senior official with access to confidential information.

title: The new malaise of civilization: When words, truth and reality fall apart
subhead: The proliferation of wars, increase in mental health disorders, devaluation of speech, and loss of connection to reality are troubling signs of the tipping point our societies are facing. Nearly a century ago, Freud identified a malaise that resonates with what we are going through today.
